channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: A mom wrote a book to help her kids cope with dad’s death. Now she’s on trial for his killing
Faster than the Brahmos: What is Golden Horizon ballistic missile Israel is offering India?
Regime change or nuclear disarmament? What Trump wants in Iran
Who is ‘John Barron’, the C-Span caller sounding like Trump, who slammed tariff ruling?
Narcos Mexico: Inside the notorious drug cartels that peddle coke, meth and more
Who is Ali Larijani, picked by Supreme Leader Khamenei to lead Iran if he is assassinated?
Why supporting the Kurdish cause serves India’s interests
item.description: It is time for the world’s largest democracy to embrace and cultivate the world’s largest people without a nation

item.title: After the tariff rebuke: How India should recalibrate its US strategy
item.description: The constitutional rebuke in Washington has reshaped the bargaining environment. New Delhi would be prudent to adjust its negotiating architecture accordingly

item.title: The Potus-Scotus clash: Navigating India's interests in a changing trade landscape
item.description: The US Supreme Court’s February 20 ruling is being described as a ‘stinging defeat’, setting the stage for a high-stakes, protracted legal battle over the limits of presidential authority in the economic policy of the United States

item.title: How AI is reshaping modern warfare — and why India must compete
item.description: Artificial intelligence has vast potential in reshaping military strategy, redefining operations, and revolutionising decision-making. The future of the battlefield is as much about algorithms and compute power as it is about arms — India cannot afford to miss the chance

item.title: Khajuraho and beyond: Exploring Bundelkhand’s hidden heritage
item.description: This spring, go beyond Khajuraho’s famed temples to uncover the forts, shrines and forgotten legacies that quietly shape Bundelkhand’s enduring heritage

item.title: From AI data centres to your next smartphone: The memory bottleneck is everyone’s problem
item.description: The memory shortage risks becoming a broader supply-chain problem. Unlike the pandemic-era chip crunch, which was driven largely by logistics and temporary disruptions, today’s shortage stems from a structural reorientation of manufacturing
